III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Team Leader was physically aggressive toward Youth C
injuring her right pinky finger.
Investigation DCWL received this complaint filed anonymously on 3/10/23.
I notified Youth C’s foster care worker that DCWL was assigned to
investigate the complaint. The foster care worker expressed no
additional concerns about the facility.
On 3/10/23 while at the facility Consultant 2 observed Youth C’s
right pinky finger and took a photograph. There was no visible
injury to her hand or finger. Consultant 2 said Youth C told her
there was “nothing wrong” with her finger.
On 3/13/23 I interviewed Youth C jointly with Government Worker
1 and Rights Officer present. She said her finger was never
injured and she denied being physically disciplined by any staff,
including Team Leader. Months ago, Youth C said Team Leader
restrained her but that he did not hurt her.
I interviewed Team Leader jointly with Government Worker 1 and
Rights Officer present. He has worked at the facility for four
years. Government Worker 1 read the allegations aloud. Team
Leader said he did not work on Youth C’s wing and was not
involved in any alleged incident involving her on 3/8/23.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present. She has worked at the facility for 17 years.
Government Worker 1 read the allegations aloud. Staff 1 said she
worked with Youth C on 3/8/23 and that Youth C was angry at
another female staff on the wing. That day, she remembered,
Youth C told all staff to “stop talking” to her and then apologized
later. Staff 1 denied that Team Leader or any other staff used
physical intervention to discipline Youth C. She recalled that
2

Team Leader came onto the wing briefly that day and “Youth C
gave him a hug.”
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis There is no evidence Team Leader was physically aggressive
toward Youth C on 3/8/23.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112 Staff qualifications
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 witnessed the injury and said Youth C deserved it.
Investigation Youth C denied Team Leader hurt her and that Staff 1 said she
deserved it.
Team Leader denied knowledge of any negative interactions
between Youth C and Staff 1.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1 and Rights
Officer present. She has worked at the facility for 17 years.
Government Worker 1 read the allegations aloud. Staff 1 said she
worked with Youth C on 3/8/23 and that Youth C was angry at
another female staff on the wing. That day, she remembered,
Youth C told all staff to “stop talking” to her and then apologized
later. Staff 1 denied that Team Leader or any other staff used
physical intervention to discipline Youth C. She recalled that
Team Leader came onto the wing briefly that day and “Youth C
gave him a hug.”
Analysis There is no evidence Staff 1 witnessed an injury on Youth C,
made an inappropriate comment, or has an inability to perform the
duties of her assigned position.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
